rev.comment: /* The Daily Prophet */ no rationale for this use
rev.diff:
Line 212: Line 212:
==Newspapers and magazines==
==Newspapers and magazines==
===''The Daily Prophet''===
===''The Daily Prophet''===
â
[[Image:Skeeter hp.jpg|thumb|right|150 px|[[Rita Skeeter]], a reporter of ''The Daily Prophet'', as portrayed by [[Miranda Richardson]].]]
 
'''''The Daily Prophet''''' is the most widely-read daily newspaper in [[United Kingdom|Britain]]'s [[Wizarding world|wizard]] community.<ref>{{cite news | url = http://www.irishexaminer.com/breaking/index.aspx?c=ireland&jp=cwmhgbidcwid | title = Harry Potter newspaper designed by Muggles | work = [[Irish Examiner]] | date = 2005-12-27 | accessdate = 2007-09-08 }}</ref> The articles include moving pictures.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.timewastersguide.com/review/1566/Harry-Potter-and-the-Order-of-the-Phoenix | title = Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix | work = The Official [[Time Wasters Guide]] | date = [[July 10]], [[2007]] | accessdate = 2007-09-08 }}</ref><ref>{{cite book | title = Roger Ebert's Movie Yearbook 2007| author = Roger Ebert | pages = 285-6 | year = 2006 | isbn = 0740761579 }}</ref> The Sunday edition is called ''The Sunday Prophet''.<ref>{{cite book | title = The Harry Potter Companion| author = Acascias Riphouse | pages = p.54 | year = 2004 | isbn = 1589395824}}</ref> Unfortunately, its journalistic integrity is somewhat lacking; it has been known to be more concerned about sales than about factual accuracy and is often a mouthpiece for the Ministry of Magic, as described by [[Rita Skeeter]] "The Prophet exists to sell itself!".<ref>{{cite journal | title = Harry Potter and the Separation of Powers: A Law and Literature - Review of J.K. Rowlingâs Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix | author = Colette Spanyol | url = http://perseus.herts.ac.uk/uhinfo/library/k65092_3.pdf | journal = Hertfordshire Law Journal | volume = 3 | issue = 1 | pages = 12â16 |format=PDF}}</ref>
'''''The Daily Prophet''''' is the most widely-read daily newspaper in [[United Kingdom|Britain]]'s [[Wizarding world|wizard]] community.<ref>{{cite news | url = http://www.irishexaminer.com/breaking/index.aspx?c=ireland&jp=cwmhgbidcwid | title = Harry Potter newspaper designed by Muggles | work = [[Irish Examiner]] | date = 2005-12-27 | accessdate = 2007-09-08 }}</ref> The articles include moving pictures.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.timewastersguide.com/review/1566/Harry-Potter-and-the-Order-of-the-Phoenix | title = Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix | work = The Official [[Time Wasters Guide]] | date = [[July 10]], [[2007]] | accessdate = 2007-09-08 }}</ref><ref>{{cite book | title = Roger Ebert's Movie Yearbook 2007| author = Roger Ebert | pages = 285-6 | year = 2006 | isbn = 0740761579 }}</ref> The Sunday edition is called ''The Sunday Prophet''.<ref>{{cite book | title = The Harry Potter Companion| author = Acascias Riphouse | pages = p.54 | year = 2004 | isbn = 1589395824}}</ref> Unfortunately, its journalistic integrity is somewhat lacking; it has been known to be more concerned about sales than about factual accuracy and is often a mouthpiece for the Ministry of Magic, as described by [[Rita Skeeter]] "The Prophet exists to sell itself!".<ref>{{cite journal | title = Harry Potter and the Separation of Powers: A Law and Literature - Review of J.K. Rowlingâs Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix | author = Colette Spanyol | url = http://perseus.herts.ac.uk/uhinfo/library/k65092_3.pdf | journal = Hertfordshire Law Journal | volume = 3 | issue = 1 | pages = 12â16 |format=PDF}}</ref>
